Zogres are encountered during the Zogre Flesh Eaters quest and live south of Castle Wars. When burying their bones a skogre may appear and attack. Their name is a portmanteau of 'zombie ogre'. According to Juna, zombie ogres fought for Zamorak during the God Wars and 'could repel the forces of Saradomin with their stench alone.'

Contents

  • 1 Locations
  • 2 Strengths and weaknesses
  • 3 Drops
    • 3.1 100%
    • 3.2 Tertiary
  • 4 Trivia
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 See also
  • 7 References

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Jiggig447Maplink
Jiggig Dungeon444Maplink
Jiggig Dungeon (lower level)4423Maplink

Strengths and weaknesses[edit | edit source]

Zogres are almost immune to normal weapons (you will hit just as often, but damage is reduced by 80%, a halberd of any kind is recommended to strike from distance), brutal arrows are effective against them, as is the Crumble Undead spell (damage is halved, for a maximum of 8). Also, poison works full power, so p++ weapons might be good against them.

Zogres are also capable of infecting the player with disease. Disease can be cured with Relicym's balm or Sanfew serum, which may be bought from Uglug Nar outside Jiggig for 200 coins (Relicym's balm only), or made using Herblore. An inoculation bracelet will prevent damage taken from disease, but will not grant immunity to becoming diseased.

Drops[edit | edit source]

The average Zogre kill is worth 1,786.

100%[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Ogre coffin key1Always1,32760
Zogre bones1Always4590

Tertiary[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Zogre bone11/4[d 1][1]Not soldN/A
Zombie champion scroll11/5,000Not sold0
  1. ^ The Zogre bone is only dropped during Rag and Bone Man II.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The zogres playing the drums can be attacked but only with Ranged or Magic. Players will also need to telegrab their items, should they wish to pick them up.
  • The colour of the drums that the zogres play is slightly lighter than that of the other drums.

'''Zogres''' are encountered during the [[Zogre Flesh Eaters]] quest and live south of [[Castle Wars]]. When burying their bones a [[skogre]] may appear and attack. Their name is a portmanteau of 'zombie ogre'. According to [[Juna]], zombie ogres fought for [[Zamorak]] during the [[God Wars]] and 'could repel the forces of [[Saradomin]] with their stench alone.'

==Strengths and weaknesses==
Zogres are almost immune to normal weapons (you will hit just as often, but damage is reduced by 80%, a [[halberd]] of any kind is recommended to strike from distance), [[brutal arrows]] are effective against them, as is the [[Crumble Undead]] spell (damage is halved, for a maximum of 8). Also, [[poison]] works full power, so [[super poison|p++]] weapons might be good against them.

Zogres are also capable of infecting the player with [[disease]]. Disease can be cured with [[Relicym's balm]] or [[Sanfew serum]], which may be bought from [[Uglug Nar]] outside Jiggig for 200 [[coins]] (Relicym's balm only), or made using [[Herblore]]. An [[inoculation bracelet]] will prevent damage taken from disease, but will not grant immunity to becoming diseased.

==Trivia==
*The zogres playing the drums can be attacked but only with [[Ranged]] or [[Magic]]. Players will also need to telegrab their items, should they wish to pick them up.
*The colour of the drums that the zogres play is slightly lighter than that of the other drums.
